html: 10.30.24  9:46 am   I'm autistic, but I have a not autistic friend and they told me that you do not always answer in a straight forward way in your answers. Sometimes you say the opposite of the answer you really mean. I would ask if this is true, but I would have no idea if the answer you give is the true or the opposite of what is true. Apparently people don't always just say direct answers to questions and I don't understand why. Apparently that is autism, but it seems more to me like everyone else is the weird one for not just answering questions directly. And if everyone else knows that you can never know if someone is answering a question directly and honestly, how does anyone function?
10.30.24  8:46 am   what's spookier? halloween or the day before/after halloween

10.30.24  12:54 am   i think many would say your lyrics are abstract; rhythmic elements designed to support the music you're writing. but do any of your lyrics have a clear meaning you're trying to communicate? in particular, i can't shake the feeling that there's a story to follow in "When I Get Older."
